info.title: REST APIs for Oracle Database
info.description: Provide consumers the ability to perform operations with different Oracle Database features through a web REST API that can be easily adopted.
info.x-summary: Provide consumers the ability to perform operations with different Oracle Database features through a web REST API that can be easily adopted.

tags.name: Rapid Home Provisioning/Manage Gold Images
tags.description: You can create gold images and series to manage your deployments.

tags.name: Rapid Home Provisioning/Manage Operation Results
tags.description: You can verify the status and retrieve the output messages of any operation that creates a job to handle its scheduled execution like imaging, provisioning, upgrade and patching operations of software homes.

tags.name: Rapid Home Provisioning/Patch Software homes
tags.description: You can move from one provisioned copy of a gold image to a provisioned copy of a gold image that is at a higher patch level.

tags.name: Rapid Home Provisioning/Patch Unmanaged Software Homes
tags.description: You can move from one software home that is not a copy of a gold image to a provisioned copy of a gold image that is at a higher patch level than the first software home.

tags.name: Rapid Home Provisioning/Provisioning Software homes
tags.description: You can provision a working copy of a gold image.

tags.name: Rapid Home Provisioning/Upgrade Software homes
tags.description: You can move from one provisioned copy of a gold image to a provisioned copy of a gold image that is at a higher version.

tags.name: Rapid Home Provisioning/Upgrade Unmanaged Software Homes
tags.description: You can move from one software home that is not a copy of a gold image to a provisioned copy of a gold image that is at a higher version level than the first software home.

authorizationHeader.name: Authorization
authorizationHeader.description: Base64 encoding of the user name and password of the user making the request. For more information, see Authentication for Rapid Home Provisioning.

dbUNamePathParam.name: dbUniqueName
dbUNamePathParam.description: Name of database (DB_UNIQUE_NAME) to be provisioned

destWcIdPatParam.name: destWcId
destWcIdPatParam.description: Name of the destination working copy to which the Oracle Software needs to be moved

imageTypeQueryParam.name: imageType
imageTypeQueryParam.description: The software type. ("ORACLEDBSOFTWARE" (default) for Oracle database software, "ORACLEGISOFTWARE" for Oracle Grid Infrastructure software, ORACLEGGSOFTWARE for Oracle GoldenGate software, "LINUXOS" for linux Opearting System ISO, and "SOFTWARE" for all other software. For a custom image type, use the image type name.)

imageTypePathParam.name: imageType
imageTypePathParam.description: The software type. ("ORACLEDBSOFTWARE" (default) for Oracle database software, "ORACLEGISOFTWARE" for Oracle Grid Infrastructure software, ORACLEGGSOFTWARE for Oracle GoldenGate software, "LINUXOS" for linux Opearting System ISO, and "SOFTWARE" for all other software. For a custom image type, use the image type name.)

jobIdPathParam.name: jobId
jobIdPathParam.description: Unique integer job ID value for the scheduled job.

jobAccepted202Response.description: Accepted. A JSON object containing job resource details of the accepted operation to obtain status and output of the progress.

Location.description: URL to the job that will execute the operation

okSingleJobResponse.description: OK. A JSON object containing a job resource representation with multiple properties and the links array with at least the "self" link.

okSingleJobOutputResponse.description: OK. A JSON object containing a job output resource representation with multiple properties and the links array with at least the "self" link.

errorResponse.description: Unexpected error. A JSON object containing error details of the issue while executing the operation.

badRequestResponse.description: Bad Request. A JSON object containing error details of the issue found while parsing a parameter value or name.

okArrayOfItemsResponse.description: OK. A JSON object containing an "items" property populated with 0 or more elements with at least an Id property and the links array with at least the "self" link.

okSingleImageResponse.description: OK. A JSON object containing an image resource representation with multiple properties and the links array with at least the "self" link.

okDeleteImageResponse.description: OK. A JSON object containing an image resource representation with multiple properties and the links array with at least the "self" link. Only if it was successfully deleted.

okSingleSeriesResponse.description: OK. A JSON object containing a series resource representation with multiple properties and the links array with at least the "self" link.

okDeleteSeriesResponse.description: OK. A JSON object containing a series resource representation with multiple properties and the links array with at least the "self" link. Only if it was successfully deleted.

okSingleWorkingcopyResponse.description: OK. A JSON object containing a working copy resource representation with multiple properties and the links array with at least the "self" link.

tags: Rapid Home Provisioning/Patch Unmanaged Software Homes
patch.summary: Patch an unmanaged Oracle Database Software home
patch.description: Moves a database from the unamanged Oracle Database Software home to a patched working copy.

tags: Rapid Home Provisioning/Upgrade Unmanaged Software Homes
put.summary: Upgrade an unmanaged Oracle Database Software home
put.description: Upgrade a database on the specified Oracle Database Software home

tags: Rapid Home Provisioning/Upgrade Unmanaged Software Homes
put.summary: Upgrade unmanaged Grid Infrastructure Software home
put.description: Upgrades the Oracle Grid Infrastructure from the source home path to the destination working copy.

tags: Rapid Home Provisioning/Patch Unmanaged Software Homes
patch.summary: Patch unmanaged Grid Infrastructure Software home
patch.description: Moves the Oracle Grid Infrastructure from the source home path to the destination working copy.

get.description: Display the name of all the existing gold images in the server.

post.description: Create a gold image from the Software home specified in the body of this request, can be of Oracle Database, Grid Infrastructure or any other Software home.

get.summary: Lists all the gold images that matches the specified query parameters.
get.description: Display the name of all the existing gold images in the server that matches the search parameters specified.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: The OS platform to which the images correspond.

parameters.name: drift
parameters.description: Lists the bug fixes not included in the golden image.

get.summary: Display the configuration of the specified image
get.description: Display the details of the gold image associated to the given image name.

parameters.name: dbtemplate
parameters.description: Displays template file names in the default template directory.

delete.description: Delete the gold image represented by the given image name.

get.description: Returns a list of all the jobs available in the server.
Return the configuration of the Job resource associated to the given job Id.

get.summary: Get the job output and result
get.description: Gets the job output presenting the job result and progress, which can be paginated using the limit and offset parameters.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of lines from the job result to be included in the job output resource.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The identifier of the first line on the job result to be included in the job output resource.

get.description: Returns a list of series names available in the server.
Returns a list of the series that matches either the image or the server provided.
Return the series resource details of the seris associated to the given series Id and server

post.description: Creates a new series resource with the given name in the seriesId parameter.

delete.description: Delete the image series from the server, but leave all the images intact.

post.description: Add an existing image to an existing series.

delete.description: Removes an existing image from an existing series.

post.summary: Subscribe a user to a series
post.description: Add an existing user to the subscribed users list for an existing series.

delete.summary: Unsubscribe a user from a series
delete.description: Removes an existing user from the subscribed users list for an existing series.

get.description: Returns a list of names working copies available on the server.

post.description: Creates a new working copy using an existing gold image

get.summary: Get working copies based on a certain image type
get.description: Return the list of working copies based on a given golden image.

post.description: Provision a new Oracle Database on a managed working copy.

patch.summary: Patch an Oracle Database Software home
patch.description: Moves a database from a source working copy to a patched working copy.

put.summary: Upgrade an Oracle Database Software home
put.description: Upgrade a database from a source working copy to a patched working copy.
Upgrades the Oracle Grid Infrastructure from the source working copy to the destination working copy.

patch.description: Moves the Oracle Grid Infrastructure from the source working copy to the destination working copy.

sourcewc.description: Name of the source working copy from which the Oracle Grid Infrastructure needs to be upgraded.

destwc.description: Name of the destination working copy to which the Oracle Grid Infrastructure needs to be upgraded.

image.description: Image name from the configured images.

targetnode.description: Name of a node in a remote cluster with no Rapid Home Provisioning Client.

ignoreprereq.description: To ignore the CVU pre-requisite checks.

path.description: The absolute path for the destination working copy.

root.description: Use root credentials to access the remote node.

sudoUser.description: perform super user operations as sudo user name.

superUserPasswd.description: The password for the super user account.

authArgs.description: Additional properties for the selected authentication plugin.

auth.description: Use an authentication plugin to access the remote node.

schedule.description: Preferred time to execute the operation, in ISO-8601 format. For example: 2016-12-21T19:13:17+05.

newpqpool.description: Server pool name for pool to be created

dbtemplate.description: Absolute file path for the template file or relative path to the image home directory on Rapid Home Provisioning Server

targetnode.description: Node on which operation needs to be executed

datafileDestination.description: Data file destination location or ASM disk group name

numberOfPDBs.description: Number of PDBs to be created

pdbName.description: The pdbName prefix if one or more PDBs need to be created

cdb.description: To create database as container database

dbtype.description: Type of database: Oracle RAC One Node or Oracle RAC or Single Instance

useractiondata.description: Value to be passed to useractiondata parameter of useraction script

root.description: Use root credentials to access the remote node.

sudoUser.description: perform super user operations as sudo user name.

superUserPasswd.description: The password for the super user account.

authArgs.description: Additional properties for the selected authentication plugin.

auth.description: Use an authentication plugin to access the remote node.

schedule.description: Preferred time to execute the operation, in ISO-8601 format. For example: 2016-12-21T19:13:17+05.

imageType.description: The software type. ("ORACLEDBSOFTWARE" (default) for Oracle database software, "ORACLEGISOFTWARE" for Oracle Grid Infrastructure software, ORACLEGGSOFTWARE for Oracle GoldenGate software, "LINUXOS" for linux Opearting System ISO, and "SOFTWARE" for all other software. For a custom image type, use the image type name.)

schedule.description: Preferred time to execute the operation, in ISO-8601 format. For example: 2016-12-21T19:13:17+05.

targetnode.description: Node on which operation needs to be executed.

useractiondata.description: Value to be passed to useractiondata parameter of useraction script.

pathOwner.description: User with read access to files under the specified path.

zip.description: Absolute path of the compressed software home to be imported (a ZIP or TAR file).

version.description: Oracle database version for GIAAS, ODA patchbundle version for ODAPATCHSOFTWARE.

path.description: Absolute path location of the software home to be imported (For database images, this will be the ORACLE_HOME).

root.description: Use root credentials to access the remote node.

sudoUser.description: perform super user operations as sudo user name.

superUserPasswd.description: The password for the super user account.

authArgs.description: Additional properties for the selected authentication plugin.

auth.description: Use an authentication plugin to access the remote node.

cc.description: List of users to whom email notifications will be sent, in addition to owner of working copy.

psu.description: Bug number or downloaded zip location or released PSU/BP.

patches.description: Comma separated bug numbers or NFS downloaded zip location or combination of both.

port.description: Port number in the range of 1024-65536.

targetnode.description: Node on which operation needs to be executed

setupSSH.description: sets up passwordless SSH user equivalence on the remote nodes for the provisioning user.

node.description: Comma-separated list of nodes on which database will be created

root.description: Use root credentials to access the remote node.

sudoUser.description: perform super user operations as sudo user name.

superUserPasswd.description: The password for the super user account.

authArgs.description: Additional properties for the selected authentication plugin.

auth.description: Use an authentication plugin to access the remote node.

schedule.description: Preferred time to execute the operation, in ISO-8601 format. For example: 2016-12-21T19:13:17+05.

user.description: Name of the user for whom the software home is being provisioned.

clusterNodes.description: Comma-separated list of node information on which Oracle Clusterware will be provisioned.

isfixup.description: Execute fixup script. Valid only for Grid Infrastructure provisioning.

asmClientData.description: File that contains the ASM client data.

gnsClientData.description: File that contains the GNS client data.

oracleBase.description: ORACLE_BASE path for provisioning Oracle database home or Oracle Grid Infrastructure home.

agpath.description: Read/write path for the persistent Oracle home path.

aupath.description: Read-only gold image path for the persistent Oracle home path.

ignorePrereq.description: To ignore the CVU pre-requisite checks.

path.description: Absolute path location of the software home to be imported (For database images, this will be the ORACLE_HOME).

dbtemplate.description: Absolute file path for the template file or relative path to the image home directory on Rapid Home Provisioning Server.

dbname.description: Name of database (DB_UNIQUE_NAME) to be provisioned.

storagetype.description: Type of storage for the home.

datafileDestination.description: Data file destination location or ASM disk group name.

serverpool.description: Comma-separated list of existing server pool names.

numberOfPDBs.description: Number of PDBs to be created.

newpool.description: Server pool name for pool to be created.

pdbName.description: The pdbName prefix if one or more PDBs need to be created.

cdb.description: To create database as container database.

dbtype.description: Type of database: Oracle RAC One Node or Oracle RAC or Single Instance.

sourcewc.description: Name of the source working copy from which the Oracle Grid Infrastructure needs to be upgraded.

targetnode.description: Node on which operation needs to be executed

ignoreprereq.description: To ignore the CVU pre-requisite checks.

path.description: Absolute path location of the software home to be imported (For database images, this will be the ORACLE_HOME).

root.description: Use root credentials to access the remote node.

sudoUser.description: perform super user operations as sudo user name.

superUserPasswd.description: The password for the super user account.

authArgs.description: Additional properties for the selected authentication plugin.

auth.description: Use an authentication plugin to access the remote node.

schedule.description: Preferred time to execute the operation, in ISO-8601 format. For example: 2016-12-21T19:13:17+05.

dbname.description: Name of database (DB_UNIQUE_NAME) to be provisioned.

agpath.description: Read/write path for the persistent Oracle home path.

aupath.description: Read-only gold image path for the persistent Oracle home path.

cc.description: List of users to whom email notifications will be sent, in addition to owner of working copy.

ignorewcpatches.description: Ignores if the patched working copy is missing some patches which are present in the source path or working copy.

noDataPatch.description: Indicates that "datapatch" should not be executed for databases being moved.

useractiondata.description: Value to be passed to useractiondata parameter of useraction script

root.description: Use root credentials to access the remote node.

sudoUser.description: perform super user operations as sudo user name.

superUserPasswd.description: The password for the super user account.

authArgs.description: Additional properties for the selected authentication plugin.

auth.description: Use an authentication plugin to access the remote node.

schedule.description: Preferred time to execute the operation, in ISO-8601 format. For example: 2016-12-21T19:13:17+05.

drain_timeout.description: Service drain timeout specified in seconds.

skip.description: Skip current batch of nodes and restart databases on the next batch of nodes.

stopoption.description: Stop option for database: ABORT, IMMEDIATE, NORMAL, TRANSACTIONAL, TRANSACTIONAL_LOCAL.

continueRestart.description: Continue restarting databases on the next batch of nodes.

disconnect.description: Disconnect all sessions before stopping or relocating services.

keepplacement.description: Ensure that services of administrator-managed Oracle RAC or Oracle RAC One databases are running on the same instances before and after the move operation.

revert.description: Revert to source Oracle home or working copy in case of batch-move or smartmove.

targetnode.description: Node on which operation needs to be executed

separate.description: Process batches separately. Move operation pauses for user intervention before continuing with the next batch.

saf.description: Service availability factor, the minimum percentage of instances on which a service must remain running during the move.

oraclebase.description: ORACLE_BASE path for provisioning Oracle database home or Oracle Grid Infrastructure home.

targetnode.description: Node on which operation needs to be executed

agpath.description: Read/write path for the persistent Oracle home path.

aupath.description: Read-only gold image path for the persistent Oracle home path.

ignorewcpatches.description: Ignores if the patched working copy is missing some patches which are present in the source path or working copy.

saf.description: Service availability factor, the minimum percentage of instances on which a service must remain running during the move.

batches.description: List of batches of nodes in the format: "(Ba),...,(Bz)".

nonrolling.description: Move the Oracle home in non-rolling mode.

smartmove.description: Auto-generate the list of batches of nodes and move databases by restarting instances batch after batch.

excludedblist.description: Patch all databases except the specified databases.

cleanpids.description: Cleans up processes during Oracle Grid Infrastructure move operation.

continue.description: Continue restarting CRS stack on the next batch of nodes.

useractiondata.description: Value to be passed to useractiondata parameter of useraction script.

draintimeout.description: Service drain timeout specified in seconds.

nodatapatch.description: Indicates that "datapatch" should not be executed for databases being moved.

dbhomes.description: Mapping of source and destination working copies in the format: "<source_wc1>=<dest_wc1>,...,<source_oracle_home_path>=<dest_wcN>".

auto.description: Automatically patch databases along with patching Grid Infrastructure.

disconnect.description: Disconnect all sessions before stopping or relocating services.

keepplacement.description: Ensure that services of administrator-managed Oracle RAC or Oracle RAC One databases are running on the same instances before and after the move operation.

revert.description: Revert to source Oracle home or working copy in case of batch-move or smartmove.

path.description: The absolute path for the destination working copy.

root.description: Use root credentials to access the remote node.

sudoUser.description: Perform super user operations as sudo user name.

superUserPasswd.description: The password for the super user account.

authArgs.description: Additional properties for the selected authentication plugin.

auth.description: Use an authentication plugin to access the remote node.

schedule.description: Preferred time to execute the operation, in ISO-8601 format. For example: 2016-12-21T19:13:17+05.

before.description: Name of the image before which new image will inserted.

type.description: Link to HTTP error code page.

instance.description: URI to the link that provides more detail about the error.

errorDetails.description: If multiple errors are reported they can be organized in a hierarchical structure in this array.

errorPath.description: XPath or JSON path to indicate where the error occurs.

errorCode.description: Application specific error code, related to the error message shown at tittle.

rel.description: Specify the type of relationship the link has with the described resource.

href.description: The referenced hyperlink element provided in an absolute format.

rel.description: Specify the type of relationship the link has with the described resource.

href.description: The referenced hyperlink element provided in an absolute format with the correct URL parameters.
